questionText: What comes next in the series: 5, 11, 23, 47, ?
A clock gains 5 minutes every hour. How many minutes will it gain in a day?
If 3A + 2B = 18 and A - B = 2, find A.
Find the missing number: 2, 6, 12, 20, ?, 42
If in a code, ACE = 135, then BDF = ?
Which number replaces the question mark: 8, 27, 64, 125, ?
Find the next term: 1, 4, 9, 16, ?, 36
Which number is the odd one out: 121, 144, 169, 182, 196
If 2x + 3 = 17, find the value of x.
Simplify: 3(2x - 4) + 2(x + 1)
What comes next in this analogy: 3 : 27 :: 4 : ?
If the perimeter of a square is 40 cm, what is its area?
What number should come in place of ?: 6, 11, 21, 36, ?
A man walks 20m north, turns right and walks 30m, turns right and walks 35m. In which direction is he now?
Choose the word that does not belong to the group: Apple, Banana, Mango, Carrot
Find the next term in the series: 2, 3, 5, 8, 12, 17, ?
Which number is missing: 4, 9, ?, 25, 36
If A = 1, B = 2, ..., Z = 26, then what is the value of FACE?
If 3^x = 81, then x = ?
Identify the correctly punctuated sentence.
options: Although it was raining but we went out.
Although it was raining, we went out.
Although it was raining; but we went out.
Although, it was raining we went out.
correctAnswer: Although it was raining, we went out.

questionText: Choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to 'Recalcitrant'.
Select the word that best completes the sentence: 'He has a ___ for solving complex puzzles.'
Choose the correct transformation: 'No other city is as beautiful as Paris.'
options: Paris is more beautiful than any other city.
Paris is less beautiful than some cities.
Paris is as beautiful as all cities.
Paris is not a beautiful city.
correctAnswer: Paris is more beautiful than any other city.

questionText: Find the synonym of 'Esoteric'.
Which of the following is a complex sentence?
options: Although it was raining, she went for a run.
She went running and I stayed home.
correctAnswer: Although it was raining, she went for a run.

questionText: Choose the grammatically correct sentence.
options: Neither he nor I is going.
Neither he nor I am going.
Neither he nor I are going.
Neither he or I is going.
correctAnswer: Neither he nor I am going.

questionText: Identify the part of speech for the underlined word: 'She sings beautifully.'
Select the correct indirect form: He said, 'I will go tomorrow.'
options: He said he would go the next day.
He said he will go tomorrow.
He said he is going tomorrow.
He said he was going next day.
correctAnswer: He said he would go the next day.

questionText: Which sentence uses the subjunctive mood?
options: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
I am going to the market.
correctAnswer: If I were rich, I would travel the world.

questionText: If the simple interest on ₹2500 for 2 years is ₹300, what is the rate of interest?
A train 150 m long is running at 60 km/h. How long will it take to cross a man standing on the platform?
The ratio of ages of A and B is 3:5. After 10 years, the ratio becomes 5:7. Find the present age of A.
A man can row 12 km downstream in 3 hours and upstream in 4 hours. What is the speed of the stream?
If 40% of a number is 80, what is the number?
A can do a piece of work in 20 days and B in 30 days. In how many days will they complete it together?
The cost price of an article is ₹600 and profit is 25%. What is the selling price?
A shopkeeper gives a discount of 10% and still makes a profit of 8%. What is the cost price of a ₹500 marked product?
The average of 5 consecutive odd numbers is 35. What is the smallest number?
The perimeter of a circle is 132 cm. Find its radius.
A man spends 80% of his income. If he earns ₹25000, how much does he save?
A train 240 m long passes a pole in 24 sec. What is its speed?
A bag contains 4 red, 5 blue and 6 green balls. What is the probability of picking a blue ball?
If the radius of a cylinder is doubled and height is halved, its volume will be:
The HCF of 72 and 120 is:
What is the compound interest on ₹10000 for 2 years at 10% per annum?
What will be the compound interest on ₹8000 at 5% p.a. for 2 years?
In a class, 60% are girls. If there are 40 students, how many are boys?
Find the area of a triangle with base 10 cm and height 6 cm.
The difference between SI and CI for ₹10000 at 10% p.a. for 2 years is:
